ECO3070 - Tutoring/Teaching Techniques f.name: ECO3070 - Tutoring/Teaching Techniques for Undergraduate Economics

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Satisfactory completion of same course the student is tutoring.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Prepare undergraduate students to more effectively learn economics concepts through tutoring/teaching.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The determination of prices in a market economy; their role in allocating consumer and producer goods and in distributing incomes, including attempts to improve market efficiency through public policy. Honors content.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Theoretical study of the behavior of households, firms, and the markets in which they operate with issues and applications.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Measurement, analysis, and control of aggregate economic activity.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Build students' analytical and quantitative skills through the application of economic theory to social problems and issues.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An introduction to macroeconomics, including an overview of the market economy; national income, employment, and price level determination, stabilization policies, and international economics.

ECO2013H - Honors Principles of Economic.name: ECO2013H - Honors Principles of Economics Macroeconomics

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Same as ECO 2013 with honors-level content.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: International macroeconomics with review and analysis of current international macroeconomics, financial issues, policies and events.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A study of the principal ideas of the major contributors to the development of economic thought.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A study of the strategic decision-making of parties having opposed, mixed, or similar interests.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A study of fiscal institutions and decision-making, and how government budgetary policy (spending, taxing, borrowing, and debt management) affects the economy and its citizens.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Students will study the linear regression model, first developing the theory and then applying it to data

ECO4400H - Honors Game Theory and Econom.name: ECO4400H - Honors Game Theory and Economic Applications

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An introduction to the study of the strategic decision-making of parties having opposed, mixed, or similar interests. Consent of Honors

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Building on the linear regression model of Econometrics I, students will study generalized linear models, first developing the theory and then applying it to data.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The determination of prices in a market economy; their role in allocating consumer and producer goods and in distributing incomes, including attempts to improve market efficiency through public policy.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Nature of money, commercial banking system, and monetary theory, and their relationship to the level of economic activity and activities of the Federal Reserve and U.S. Treasury.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: ECO 3410 and ECO 4412, or permission of department.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Fundamental principles of Classical and Neoclassical international trade theories, as well as trade's impact on global resource flows and the impact of trade on the developing world. Trade policy both in theory and practice is also examined.

ECO4444 - Introduction to Business Analy.name: ECO4444 - Introduction to Business Analytics for FinTech

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Provide an introduction to the programming languages and analytical tools commonly used to analyze data for business and financial decision making.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Mathematical methods with particular focus on microeconomics foundations of individual decision-making.

ECO4714 - Advanced Topics in Internation.name: ECO4714 - Advanced Topics in International Economics

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The objective is to understand the functioning of international financial markets and the theories describing how asset prices and macroeconomic variables are determined globally.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Emphasis on international topics in linear and nonlinear econometric models.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Consent of department chair, ECO 3101, and ECO 3203.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Supervised economics-related work experience in a pre-approved sponsoring organization. See department for information/application.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Impact of law on economic behavior; how economic behavior changes with legal rules and penalties; and the economic logic underlying the law.
